poem:
**Ceasefire Morning**

In Gaza's tender hush,  
a dance of releases—  
soft reciprocity,  
20 souls exhale,  
fingers unlock,  
shadows lift  
in the dawn's cradle.  
Hope trembles  
as a child,  
finding footing  
on land newly thawed—  
fragile seeds,  
whispering peace,  
softly breaking  
ground.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Israel expects all 20 living hostages to be freed from Gaza on Monday morning The Israeli government says it expects all living hostages held in Gaza to be released on Monday morning and that it is preparing for the release of about 2,000 Palestinian detainees, the crucial next phase of the ceasefire deal that could end the two-year war in Gaza. “We are expecting all 20 of our living hostages to be released together at". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
